subject: RE: [junit] assert() in callbacks

messageBody:
RE: [junit] assert() in callbacks

Ruth Adrineda wrote:
> has anybody used [assert() in callbacks]?

I do. When I implement MockObjects (which I use for callbacks, amongst other things), I usually make them extend from junit.framework.Assert. This gives me access to all the various assert() methods.

I use assert() to enforce the contract imposed on the interface I'm mocking. If a method shouldn't take a null argument, I enforce it, and so on.

Robert.

--
     "Duct tape is like the Force: it has a light side, a dark side,
                   and it holds the universe together"
